newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia Oct palm oil output seen down three pct.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia Oct palm oil output seen down three pct.

text.p: Malaysia's palm oil output in October was estimated to have fallen three percent to 840,000 tonnes over September, crop forecaster Ivan Wong said on Monday.
Wong estimated end-October palm oil stocks at 965,000 tonnes, compared with the Palm Oil Registration and Licensing Authority's (PORLA) 894,030 tonnes at end-September.
He said palm oil exports in October were projected to be 670,000 tonnes against PORLA's 637,079 tonnes in September.
"For this month, our tentative estimated shows production declining around three percent to 840,000 tonnes," Wong said in his latest report.
"The seasonal downtrend will accelerate in November. The rainy season has started but so far this month the rains have not hampered harvesting operations in any way."
Palm oil exports this month may still remain at a healthy level around 670,000 tonnes,inclusive of some 15,000 tonnes of crude palm oil (CPO).
Malaysia crude palmoil supply-demand estimate/projection as of October 21, 1996. (All figures in '000 tonnes)
